summary: question screens make partly correct feedback optional

the user's responses are marked and the options locked but no feedback is shown and the submit button remains enabled
at the very least it might be an idea to log an error to the console along the lines of no partly correct feedback found for component xx'

summary: global jaws read keyboard cursor position issues on page loads
description: finding that transitions between pages are prompting jaws to read garbage information on load and the keyboard navigation cursor positioned incorrectly

for example transitioning from content page to has jaws saying ten thousand seven hundred forty two slash index link page has one link ten thousand seven hundred forty two slash index unlabelled seven button and the keyboard navigation cursor will be positioned over the view button not visibly but tabbing forwards once will move you to the element after it in the in this instance it looks as if jaws is reading nonsense from the address bar in this instance the url includes and then positioning the cursor in its last location on this page behaving at least partly as it should

however something similar happens when navigating to content pages with a clear browser cache and no prior scorm data loading i found that jaws would read similar nonsense and the keyboard cursor would be positioned on the last but one tab cycle element on the page tabbing forward once took you to the last element tabbing forward again cycled you back to the top of the page
seen other variations on this
on one occasion loaded as expected nothing untoward was read and the cursor was positioned at the top of the page
the only difference here was that took a while to load
however on subsequent attempts this same page loaded with the cursor positioned a little up from the bottom of the page and similar garbage information was read
this is not hugely consistent so i wonder if it is simply down to jaws trying to read parts of pages before fully loaded but hard to say
i do wonder about that first instance of loading slowly and jaws behaving itself though
does it suggest a possible cause or solution
there appear to be some problems concerning the reset attempt functionality with this slider component
however found these issues inconsistently reproducible
if the question is answered twice whether correctly or incorrectly on closing the feedback layer the cursor will be over the show feedback button but the aria label will be read
this has happened on three occasions now and it was only on the that the show feedback label was read as expected

also begun to find that the spacebar is not permitting selection of the slider number buttons but i suspect that this is not a valid issue and is instead just down to the browser and jaws being ornery
will update this ticket as i clarify the situation

summary: menu progress indicators reset between sessions
description: the progress indicators on the menu pages reset between sessions
progress is correctly retained however and accessing a content page then immediately backing out to the menu will prompt the menu progress indicator to update accordingly

summary: media component labels misapplied due to media component
description: playing and pausing the video on can lead to labels being misapplied

on this seems to lead to the aria label for being overridden and read as a duplicate of the completion status element for the element in the tab cycle immediately preceding this happens if you play the video and then pause it before it has finished
if you play the video and tab onwards past it while it is still playing then aria label is read correctly
if you don't play the video at all and just tab straight past it may either behave correctly or behave incorrectly as described i've encountered both
no pattern yet observed that would explain why

summary: plp extension no screenreader equivalent for component titles
description: at present there is no screenreader equivalent for acknowledgement of the components listed in progress that are locked behind trickle
a sighted user can see that more components are on the page they are just unavailable
however a blind screenreader user will not have any such indication and will be led to believe that as with in the kitchen sink demo there are only two components on the page

summary: media component aria label refers to transcript button that is not present
description: the aria label for this spanned media component refers to a transcript button that is not present here
since the transcript button is an optional extra this presumably isn't really a bug but i suppose we might need to acknowledge two different kinds of media component aria label dependent on its

summary: media component total duration of video read as time of day
description: when tabbing on from the play pause button keyboard navigation takes you to the total duration of the video for bbb which jaws reads as a time of day o clock this only applies to the total duration not the current position
i think it actually needs to be in the tab cycle at all nb
this does not occur with the media component on

summary: media component p read at end of intro text
description: when jaws reads the introductory text it appends the letter p to the end of it

i see any reason why it would do this but i wonder if it is related to the play pause button lacking a label this occur with the media component on but that it probably because that component does not contain any introductory or instructional text
